questions.question_text: Several applications are deployed to a managed server. You want to compare the number of completed requests for all of these applications. What is the quickest wat to accomplish this?

choices.C: Access the Administration Console. Click Monitoring > Work Managers tab for each application.
choices.A: Launch WLST and run the viewAppRuntimes() command.
choices.D: Access the Administration Console. Click the Deployments page.
choices.B: Access the Monitoring Dashboard. Click the Application Work Managers view for the managed server.

questions.question_text:
You are troubleshooting why transactions are not being committed. After investigation, you realize that these transactions have enough time during the first phase of the two-phase commit, but not enough time during the second phase. Therefore, rather than committing, they are timing out and are being rolled back.
Which Java Transaction API (JTA) attribute needs a larger value?

Consider an IT infrastructure comprising several web and EJB applications. Each application is expected to handle significantly different workloads and, therefore, has different resource and scalability requirements.
Which is the best solution?

choices.C: Configure a separate node manager for each application
choices.B: Configure a dedicated WebLogic Server for each application
choices.D: Configure a separate cluster for each application
choices.A: Configure a separate proxy for each application

discussion.content: The question says "optional". The ID is not optional.

i suppose it is B:
The Transaction Service assigns a transaction identifier (Xid) to each transaction.

questions.question_text:
You are troubleshooting Java Transaction API (JTA) transactions.
The WebLogic Server extension to JTA provides which optional transaction attribute to make troubleshooting easier?
Which action should you take to automatically back up the domain configuration when anyone activates a configuration change?

choices.A: USE the backup='true' parameter of the activate() command in WLST.
choices.B: The administration console, select "Follow Configuration changes" in the Shared Preferences for the console.
choices.D: Enabling automatic domain configuration creates backups of the configuration during server boot, not at each activation.
choices.C: In the administration console, select "Configuration Archive Enabled" under the general configuration of the domain.
